title: Rates of Change - compare average rates of change

content.prompt:
The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 4 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 3.7 comma 5.5).
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at (negative 3 comma 0).
  • The curve then increases, passing through (negative 2 comma 4), to reach a high point at (negative 1.8 comma 4.5).
  • The curve then decreases, passing through (negative 1 comma 2), to reach a low point at the origin.
  • The curve then increases, passing through (1 comma 1) to reach a high point at (1.2 comma 1.1). 
  • The curve then decreases to cross the x axis at (2 comma 0) and reaches a low point at (2.6 comma negative 0.6). 
  • The curve then increases, passing through (3 comma negative 0.3) to cross the x axis at (3.1 comma 0) and reaches a high point at (3.6 comma 0.7).
  • The curve then decreases to cross the x axis at (4 comma 0) and exits the window at (4.5 comma negative 4.5).

​The graph of the function y=gx is given. Of the following, on which interval is the average rate of change of g least?

choices.label: ​-3≤x≤-2
​-1≤x≤0
​1≤x≤2
​3≤x≤4

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
